meanings.definition: One who causes pain or suffering to others.
meanings.sent1: The afflicter brought misery to the village with their cruel actions.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was an afflicter of pain, but also a healer of wounds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous afflicter of pranks struck again, leaving laughter in their wake.
meanings.sent4: The storm was an afflicter of destruction, leaving chaos in its path.
meanings.sent5: The afflicter of sorrow cast a shadow over the land, spreading despair far and wide.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that inflicts harm or distress on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The afflicter of nightmares haunted the dreams of the young child.
meanings.sent2: The bully was an afflicter of fear among the students at school.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous afflicter of mischief caused chaos at the party.
meanings.sent4: The disease was an afflicter of pain, weakening the body with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The afflicter of troubles seemed to follow him wherever he went, like a dark cloud.
